decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly building up a board presence of aggressive Human creatures by utilizing efficient mana sources and disruptive cards like Aether Vial and Meddling Mage. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Thalia's Lieutenant provide additional support to pump up the team, while Reflector Mage and Restoration Angel offer some versatility and tempo advantage. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and relentless assault while disrupting their game plan with disruptive creatures and spells.

The deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of artifact creatures supported by equipment like Cranial Plating. It leverages efficient mana acceleration with Mox Opal and Springleaf Drum to deploy threats early in the game. The deck also includes removal in the form of Galvanic Blast and protection with Welding Jar. Steel Overseer and Master of Etherium provide additional power and toughness boosts to the team, while Inkmoth Nexus offers an alternative win condition with poison counters. Overall, the deck aims to deliver a fast and aggressive offense to outpace and defeat the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana with cards like Search for Tomorrow and Sakura-Tribe Elder to cast Scapeshift and Primeval Titan. The goal is to get Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle on the battlefield along with multiple Mountains to deal massive damage to the opponent's creatures or even directly to their life total. Additionally, cards like Obstinate Baloth and Anger of the Gods provide protection and removal to control the board. Overall, the deck aims to assemble its key pieces and combo off for a game-winning finish.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by quickly assembling UrzaTron (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a massive amount of mana. With this mana, the deck aims to play powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Eldrazi creatures like Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also includes utility spells like Oblivion Stone and Pithing Needle to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck relies on card draw and deck manipulation spells like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to find key pieces and maintain control of the game.

The deck focuses on fast-paced aggressive gameplay with a heavy emphasis on artifacts and artifact creatures. The goal is to flood the board with cheap artifact creatures like Memnite, Ornithopter, and Signal Pest, while boosting them with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer. Arcbound Ravager adds versatility and resilience to the deck, and Mox Opal provides ramp and fixing. The inclusion of burn spells like Galvanic Blast and a Mountain ensures that the deck can also deal direct damage to the opponent, maintaining pressure and finishing the game quickly.

This deck aims to aggressively fill the graveyard with cards like Bloodghast, Gurmag Angler, and Flamewake Phoenix in order to quickly bring out big threats like Hollow One. Using cards like Burning Inquiry and Goblin Lore to discard and draw cards quickly sets up explosive turns where multiple threats can come out early in the game. The combination of aggressive creatures and burn spells like Lightning Bolt allows for a fast-paced, proactive game plan that can overwhelm opponents before they have a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to ramp up mana quickly using cards like Search for Tomorrow and Farseek, while also controlling the board with removal spells like Path to Exile and Lightning Bolt. The deck's win condition comes from assembling the combo of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and Primeval Titan to deal massive damage to the opponent. Renegade Rallier and Bloodbraid Elf provide additional value and card advantage, while providing a strong aggressive presence on the board. The deck focuses on executing its combo efficiently and overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying a swarm of Human creatures onto the battlefield, using cards like Aether Vial and Noble Hierarch to accelerate its game plan. Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Meddling Mage disrupt opponents' strategies, while Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish scale up in power as more Humans enter the battlefield. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its aggressive creatures, using cards like Reflector Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to deal with any threats. Additionally, the deck includes some card advantage with Restoration Angel and Dark Confidant to maintain momentum.

The main idea of the Selesnya Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy using creatures like Courser of Kruphix, Voice of Resurgence, and Knight of the Reliquary. The deck also includes powerful support cards like Collected Company and Path to Exile to control the board and maintain pressure. Additionally, cards like Azusa, Lost but Seeking and Ramunap Excavator provide additional value by ramping up mana or recurring lands from the graveyard. The overall goal is to quickly build a strong board presence and outpace the opponent's defenses to secure victory.

The deck is focused on assembling a combo utilizing the Devoted Druid and Vizier of Remedies combo to generate infinite mana. This combo allows for casting the Walking Ballista for an infinite amount of damage to the opponent. The deck includes a variety of creatures that can be searched for and brought into play using Collected Company and Chord of Calling, creating a toolbox of options depending on the situation. The mana base is designed to support the combo and provide flexibility in searching for the necessary pieces to execute the combo efficiently.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and card draw to protect your life total and out-value your opponent. By using cards like Serum Visions, Search for Azcanta, and Snapcaster Mage to filter through your deck, along with powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Gideon Jura, you can maintain control of the board state and eventually win the game with cards like Celestial Colonnade or Secure the Wastes.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly, allowing the player to cast powerful colorless spells like Ugin, the Spirit Dragon and Karn Liberated. The deck also includes board wipes like Pyroclasm and Oblivion Stone to control the battlefield, along with ramp spells like Sylvan Scrying and Expedition Map to help find the UrzaTron lands. Overall, the deck aims to control the game by efficiently using mana and casting powerful threats to overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on quickly filling up the graveyard with cards such as Faithless Looting and Burning Inquiry to bring out powerful creatures like Hollow One and Gurmag Angler for aggressive plays. By utilizing cards like Bloodghast and Flamewake Phoenix, the deck is able to maintain a relentless tempo while using spells like Lightning Bolt and Collective Brutality for removal and disruption. The inclusion of Street Wraith and Tasigur, the Golden Fang adds versatility and options for card advantage and additional threats. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with fast-paced, impactful plays.

This aggro deck focuses on quickly flooding the board with Human creatures and disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Thalia, Meddling Mage, and Kitesail Freebooter. By using Aether Vial to cheat out creatures and leveraging mana fixing lands like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy. Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish grow in power as more Humans enter the battlefield, increasing the deck's potential for explosive turns.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through removal and countering spells, while also deploying threats in the form of Geist of Saint Traft and Spell Queller. The deck runs a mix of burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Lightning Helix, alongside counterspells like Cryptic Command and Mana Leak. Snapcaster Mage allows for additional value by recasting these spells from the graveyard. The manabase is designed to support multiple colors, allowing for flexibility in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure with its threats.
